scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a run of publications by the Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art from 1966 to 2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Paul Mellon Centre for Studies in British Art, founded in 1970, is an educational charity committed to supporting original research into the history of British art and architecture of all periods. The Centre contains an extensive library and manuscript collection, with over 12,000 books about British art. It is the sister institution to the Yale Center for British Art, with which it collaborates closely, and is part of Yale University.
